intro: Cyrtandra dispar var. glabriflora, commonly known as the smooth-flowered cyrtandra, is a species of flowering plant in the Gesneriaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly found in the islands of Indonesia and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often growing in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
